en.def: The main idea that ties parts of a story, lesson, or event together.
en.sentence: Our class party theme was space, so we made star hats and planet signs.

en.def: To say something belongs to you or is true.
en.sentence: Mina raised her hand to claim the reading chair before recess.

en.def: A strong request for help.
en.sentence: Leo made a polite plea for one more minute to finish his puzzle.

en.def: A green plant with feathery leaves.
en.sentence: The fern near the window grew taller after we watered it.

en.def: A large farm animal that can carry people and pull carts.
en.sentence: The horse trotted around the field while we counted its steps.

en.def: To not enjoy something very much.
en.sentence: I dislike soggy cereal, so I eat it right away.

en.def: A smooth liquid used in cooking and in machines.
en.sentence: We added a little oil to the pan before cooking vegetables.

en.def: A large farm animal that gives milk.
en.sentence: The cow chewed grass slowly in the sunny field.

en.def: A bag you carry on your back for school items.
en.sentence: I zipped my backpack and checked that my notebook was inside.

en.def: At a fast speed.
en.sentence: We quickly lined up when the bell rang.

en.def: A word used to show a condition or choice.
en.sentence: "If it rains, we will read indoors."

en.def: A long distance away.
en.sentence: The library is far from our class, so we walk together.

en.def: The part of your face used for breathing and smelling.
en.sentence: My nose feels cold when I walk outside in winter.

en.def: A soft food spread made from cream.
en.sentence: We spread butter on warm toast at breakfast.

en.def: An outdoor place with grass, trees, and play areas.
en.sentence: We met at the park and played tag near the swings.

en.def: The strands that grow on your head.
en.sentence: I brushed my hair before school.

en.def: The red liquid in your body that carries oxygen.
en.sentence: In science, we learned that blood helps move oxygen through the body.

en.def: Designed to keep heat in and keep you warm.
en.sentence: I wore thermal socks on the cold morning walk.

en.def: A powerful spinning wind storm.
en.sentence: The weather map showed a cyclone far out at sea.

en.def: Higher than something else.
en.sentence: The kite flew above the trees.

en.def: In the direction of something.
en.sentence: We walked toward the gym when music started.

en.def: At the same time as something else.
en.sentence: I took notes during the lesson.

en.def: Happening quickly and without warning.
en.sentence: Suddenly, the lights turned on and the room got bright.

en.def: To lose your footing for a moment.
en.sentence: I started to slip on the wet floor, then caught the rail.

en.def: The part of your face you use to speak, smile, and eat.
en.sentence: I opened my mouth wide so the dentist could check my teeth.

en.def: A very young child who needs care and comfort.
en.sentence: The baby smiled and waved at everyone in the room.

en.def: A thin net made by a spider.
en.sentence: A silver web shined in the morning light near the fence.

en.def: A part performed by one person.
en.sentence: Nia sang a solo at the class concert.

en.def: Rising quickly at a sharp angle.
en.sentence: The hill was steep, so we climbed slowly and stayed together.

en.def: A bright object in the night sky.
en.sentence: We counted stars after sunset.

en.def: Something that does not match the group.
en.sentence: This puzzle piece is a misfit in this corner.

en.def: A very small flying insect.
en.sentence: A gnat buzzed near the window.

en.def: A safe enclosure for an animal.
en.sentence: The rabbit rested in its cage after playtime.

en.def: A small animal with eight legs that can spin webs.
en.sentence: A spider built a web between two plants in the garden.

en.def: A small furry animal.
en.sentence: A mouse nibbled a seed near the hedge.

en.def: A brush used to clean your teeth.
en.sentence: I used my toothbrush after breakfast.

en.def: Received or obtained something.
en.sentence: I got my library card and checked out a new book.

en.def: Large in size.
en.sentence: The big box held all our art supplies.

en.def: A warm liquid food with vegetables, noodles, or other ingredients.
en.sentence: The soup smelled warm and delicious at lunch.

en.def: A drink made by steeping tea leaves in hot water.
en.sentence: Grandma cooled her tea before taking a sip.

en.def: A small flying insect.
en.sentence: A fly buzzed near the window.

en.def: A small jumping animal that lives near water.
en.sentence: The frog hopped across a wet rock.

en.def: A quick sound and movement in your throat that happens by surprise.
en.sentence: I got a hiccup and took slow breaths until it stopped.

en.def: To make happy sounds when something is funny.
en.sentence: We laughed at the class puppet show.

en.def: An imaginary creature in stories and games.
en.sentence: In our story, the monster turned out to be friendly.

en.def: Feeling worried or afraid.
en.sentence: I felt scared during the storm, so I sat with my family.

en.def: A small round mark.
en.sentence: I put a dot at the end of my design.

en.def: To build or put something together.
en.sentence: We used blocks to construct a tall tower.

en.def: To move close to the ground on hands and knees.
en.sentence: The baby learned to crawl across the rug.

en.def: Covered with a lot of hair.
en.sentence: The dog looked hairy after rolling in the grass.

en.def: A small flying insect that can bite.
en.sentence: We used bug spray to keep mosquitoes away.

en.def: Strength used to push or pull something.
en.sentence: We used gentle force to open the heavy library door.

en.def: A loyal animal that can be trained to help, play, and keep people company.
en.sentence: The dog waited by the door and wagged its tail when we came home.

en.def: A heavy feeling that can show up when work feels hard.
en.sentence: When I felt stress, I took a breath and finished one step at a time.

en.def: A word for something that feels or smells unpleasant.
en.sentence: The old food smelled gross, so we cleaned the lunchbox right away.

en.def: An elephantâ€™s long nose used for grabbing, spraying, and smelling.
en.sentence: The elephant used its trunk to lift a stick and splash water.

en.def: A short burst of air from your nose, often during a big laugh.
en.sentence: The class started to laugh, and one kid let out a tiny snort.

en.def: To go get something and bring it back.
en.sentence: Please fetch the marker from the table so we can keep writing.

en.def: To put food in your mouth and chew it.
en.sentence: We sit down to eat lunch before we go outside.

en.def: A colorful insect with wings that starts life as a caterpillar.
en.sentence: A butterfly landed on the flower and opened its wings in the sun.

en.def: A figure made from rolled snow.
en.sentence: We built a snowman and gave it a scarf and button eyes.

en.def: Feeling brave when trying something hard.
en.sentence: Nia felt fearless as she read her poem to the class.

en.def: A historical soldier who wore armor.
en.sentence: In the story, the knight rode to the castle gate.

en.def: A short form of "it is" or "it has".
en.sentence: "It's time to line up," the teacher said with a smile.

en.def: To move downward from a higher place.
en.sentence: The leaf began to fall when the wind picked up.

en.def: An amount that is not all, but more than a little.
en.sentence: I saved some crackers for later in the day.

en.def: The part of your face used for seeing.
en.sentence: My eye blinked fast when bright light came in the window.

en.def: A soft piece of clothing worn on your foot.
en.sentence: I put on dry socks after recess in the rain.

en.def: A space inside a building with a specific use.
en.sentence: We cleaned the room before starting our project.

en.def: A father in a family.
en.sentence: My dad read the story with me before bed.

en.def: A sudden burst of air from your nose and mouth.
en.sentence: I covered my mouth when I had to sneeze.

en.def: A breathing sound some people make while sleeping.
en.sentence: My brother can snore loudly after a long day.

en.def: A color between red and white.
en.sentence: She used a pink marker for the title on her poster.

en.def: A tool that joins papers with a small metal staple.
en.sentence: We used the stapler to keep the packet pages together.

en.def: The image you see in a mirror or shiny surface.
en.sentence: I could see my reflection in the classroom window.

en.def: To stop for a short moment, then continue.
en.sentence: We used a short pause at each comma so the sentence sounded clear.

en.def: A large area of salt water connected to an ocean.
en.sentence: The sea looked calm in the morning, and boats moved slowly near the shore.

en.def: A question word used when asking about a person.
en.sentence: Who is reading the first line today?

en.def: Playful in a light and funny way.
en.sentence: Our class shared a silly joke before we started reading.

en.def: At every time, without skipping.
en.sentence: We always put our names on our classwork before turning it in.

en.def: A large wild animal.
en.sentence: In the story, the beast turned out to be a shy forest animal.

en.def: A small flying insect that helps pollinate flowers.
en.sentence: A bee moved from flower to flower in the school garden.

en.def: A two-wheeled vehicle you pedal.
en.sentence: I wore my helmet before riding my bike on the path.

en.def: To break open suddenly.
en.sentence: The balloon burst with a loud pop during the science demo.

en.def: A small fastener used to close clothing.
en.sentence: I checked each button before lining up for class pictures.

en.def: A school room where students eat meals.
en.sentence: Our class walked quietly to the cafeteria for lunch.

en.def: A large special meal.
en.sentence: The class read a story about a family feast and holiday songs.

en.def: One of the five digits on your hand.
en.sentence: I counted on each finger to solve the math problem.

en.def: The bottom surface of a room that you stand on.
en.sentence: We kept our art supplies off the floor and on the table.

en.def: The colorful part of a plant that can make seeds.
en.sentence: Each flower in our plot opened wider in the morning sun.

en.def: The lower part of your leg used for standing and walking.
en.sentence: I tapped my foot softly while waiting my turn.

en.def: A question word used to ask about method or process.
en.sentence: How did you solve that problem so clearly?

en.def: To light something so it is easier to see.
en.sentence: The lamp helped illuminate the page during reading practice.

en.def: To make fabric by looping yarn with needles.
en.sentence: My grandma taught me how to knit a small square.

en.def: A bright flash of electricity in the sky during a storm.
en.sentence: We counted seconds after lightning to track the storm distance.

en.def: Done by hand instead of by automation.
en.sentence: The teacher showed a manual way to sort cards by pattern.

en.def: Your ability to store and recall information.
en.sentence: Memory strategies helped me remember the spelling list.

en.def: A long, flat piece of wood.
en.sentence: We balanced the plank on blocks to build a model bridge.

en.def: The leader of a school.
en.sentence: The principal greeted students at the front gate this morning.

en.def: A straight tool used to measure length.
en.sentence: I used a ruler to draw a neat line across the page.

en.def: A cleaning product used with water.
en.sentence: We used soap and warm water before lunch.

en.def: A sharp point on the stem of some plants.
en.sentence: We used gloves to avoid the thorn on the rose stem.

en.def: A child-friendly word for the stomach.
en.sentence: My tummy felt better after water and a short rest.

en.def: To reverse your last action.
en.sentence: I used undo to fix a typing mistake in my paragraph.

en.def: An animal doctor.
en.sentence: The vet checked the puppy and said it was healthy.

en.def: A period of twelve months.
en.sentence: This year our class started a new reading challenge.
